column2: Chris, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: After a hysterectomy at age 40 I began to suffer severe night sweats and hot flushes. I tried a number of "natural" therapies with no success whatsoever. I finally went on to Premarin 0.6 with great success. I literally go my life back. I reduced down to 0.3 and was taking this comfortably for nearly 5 years. I tried recently to wean myself off premarin. I was back to severe night sweats and hot flushes again to the point of absolute misery. I have been back on 0.6 for a couple of days now and already I am almost symptom free. I have not suffered any real symptoms with this drug except hair thinning but I guess that happens with age anyway. I plan now to stay on this drug for as long as I need to despite the doctor warning me to get off it!

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: Mona1946, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had a tubal ligation in 1977.  Then in 1983 I had a complete hysterectomy after being diagnosed with endometriosis.  I went on Premarin in 1983.  Then in 1988 I had a car wreck that paralyzed my left side.  My entire left side from my head to my foot still tingles all the time.  As long as I take the Premarin (I am now 64) the tingling is minimal.  I tried to stop taking the pill when I turned 60.  Within 4 days, my speech became slurred, my face drooped on the left side, my left foot dragged when I walked, and my shoulders and neck hurt terribly.  Within 24 hours of resuming the Premarin, the pain was gone, my speech was clear and I did not walk like a drunk.  I have asked a doctor, a pharmacist and a physical therapist why Premarin does this.  Not one could tell me any connection between the hormone and my weakness.  I only know I will take it forever!

column2: hotflashINsc, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: went to my Dr a total wreck refused this drug for a year lived miserable durning that year finally after many nights of hot flashes day flashes and extreme depression from menopause symptons went on the 0.6 for 2 weeks well it worked for me now my Dr has lowered the dose to 0.3 this medicine is a live saver for me feel great sleep like a baby now have more energy and at this point getting my life back to normal so yes this is working for me dont always read what you see about this drug try it first then make your decision to try it and I advise you to I am glad I changed my mind about it I will stay on it until my Dr feels we have this under control.And I now have my life back!

column2: Julie P, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: After a total hysterectomy and removal of ovaries in 2008, I declined HRT due to media coverage. However, 2 years on I felt very tired, my skin had gone very dry, my libido virtually nil!  I decided to see my doctor who prescribed me Premarin.  I have been taking this HRT therapy for 2 months now and I can honestly say it has transformed me.  My skin is a lot better, flushes have completely gone. Oh, and my dose is .625mg.  Ladies, the benefits of this product do outweigh the negatives.  So, if you are feeling lethargic, listless, experiencing flushes etc, I would recommend you give it a try! Good Luck

column9: Having had a total hysterectomy at 26 years old,HRT is a MUST!My hot flashes,moodiness,lack of sex drive,vaginal dryness,it's all horrible,and all came on literally OVERNIGHT,due to my hyster.I have found this HRT to be only minimally effective for myself. I often have really,really bad migraines ever since starting this medication. I have notices very tiny,to no change in moodiness,and the worst of everything, IS THE HOT FLASHES,that are still just as bad a s ever. In fact my bedroom air conditioner runs year round,24/7,and I live in upstate NY,where winters are frigged cold,but here I am,in 16 degree weather,sweating to death. I will no longer be taking this b\medication,instead opting for bio-identical hormones,I have heard only wonderful things about bio-identicals.I am now 28 years old,and had my total hyster 2 years ago,and obviously this has impacted my life severely.This medication does work well for me,and I do not like the side effects at all!

column2: Country Girl, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: In 1985 I had a total hysterectomy and was put on .625 Premarin.  I tried getting off it by taking it every other day but my face broke out, and cleared up in a day or two after resuming taking it.For the past several months I've been cutting my pills in half (with my doctors permission) and taking them daily.  So far no mood swings or night sweats, but I feel too warm a lot of the time.  I've also gained weight but most of it in the past 10 years after taking an office position.  I'm now 71, retired and in very good health and probably just need more exercise.

Puglovers95, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy 15 years ago, but have my ovaries, age is catching up to me, I am 53. At the age of 50 things changed for me. I had severe hot flashes and I felt like I glowed. I had trouble sleeping along with the headaches. I tried numerous other options, until my Dr. put me on premarin. I started on .03, but immediately needed a higher dose. Now I am on .45 dose. It took away the hot flashes and headaches and I sleep very well. I am over weight so I am dieting to lose weight, lost 4 pounds. It will be a battle for me, I hope premarin won't hinder me to lose weight, time will tell. I am concerned with all the news about HRT in general, but not enough to stop using premarin, it makes my life easier. I take my premarin early in the morning and by the next morning I need it or I have alittle break through hot flash, not enough to bother to get a higher dose. The only side effects I have are tingling in my feet and legs which I am watching. carefully.

column2: Brenda55, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy in 1981 at age 26.  I still have my ovaries.  At age 46 I began having hot flashes/mood swings/night sweats.  I tried to tough it out for 9 years.  The flashes became so severe I would cry at night.  My Dr put me on premarin in Dec 09 (.3 mg).  My flashes became much less severe and less frequent.  He increased me to 2 a day and my flashes pretty much went away.  Now they are starting back.  I've read where other women have been on this for 20 or 30 years.  I really don't want that to happen.  My late mother-in-law was on it for many year but quit taking it when she was 74 and her flashes and mood swings came back.  I think I can deal with them now better than when I'm in my 70's!!  I seriously considering quiting it and letting nature take it's natural course.  God give me strength!!

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: rytw44, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Premarin since 2000.  I started @ the highest dose after a partial hysterectomy due to fibroids and a 2nd surgery due to pelvic abcess infection which left one ovary non functioning and with a cyst. Over the years my gyn and I have had discussions and reduced my dosage over time (currently @ .625).  I tried to stop @ one point but the hot flashes, mood changes and inability to sleep drove me back.  I have had no problems. I do get little bumps that come and go. Also, the patchy skin showed alot this summer. I have not gained weight. I still weigh the same as when I was 18.  However, I was diagnosed with high blood pressure and cholesterol problems after the birth of my son (pre-premarin).  I take blood pressure medicine also.  However, the Premarin has been a life-saver to me.  I cannot stand the hot flashes.  The sex drive has not changed for me.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries

column9: I started taking Premarin 1.25mg following a complete hysterectomy 30 years ago. It immediately eliminated the depression I felt following the surgery. Prior to the last 6 months I did not have any problems with it. Now, however, I am experiencing a skin problem involving individual tiny bumps which itch severely. They appear on my arms, hands and trunk areas. They itch when they first appear, subside and then begin itching again. My doctors can not determine what they are or what is causing them. I do have sensitive skin, but I am suspecting that I may have developed a reaction to Premarin since it is the only drug I take. Has anyone else experienced a similar reaction?

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: Brownie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on Premarin for over 10 years. My gyn told me i was multiple fractures waiting to happen if I didnt continue to take this. I have no gray hair at age 48 and look and feel like I am in my 30's. This drug is wonderful!!!

column2: mother5, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy in September, 2000.  My physician started me off on Premarin 1.25 for about 2 years, then gradually lowered my dosage to .325.  Over the last 2 years, I have noted a great deal of hair loss.  My hair has thinned considerably.  Until this year, I had no issues with sleeping, night sweats, or muscle cramps.  Now, I am experiencing foot cramps when walking, sitting, or sleeping (they wake me up). About weight gain - I did gain 20 pounds and was able to lose the weight after joining Weight Watchers.  It took me 8 months to lose 17 pounds and it was not easy to lose it.  But it can be done.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: hhobbs, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy in Aug. 08' due to endometeriosis and ovarian cysts. I was put on Premarin the day I left the hospital. I had to increase dosage to 1.25mg due to hot flashes. I rarely have hot flashes anymore, but within the 1st 6 months of taking Premarin I have gained 30 lbs.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I'm 50 years old and I had a hysterectomyin my early 40s but did not take Premarin.  But in 2002 I started taking Premarin and it has helped so much with the night sweats, hot flashes and improves my energy level tremedously. It also seems to relieve the vaginal dryness issues as well. I do experience leg pain from time to time, but found eating a banana (for the potassium) relieves this pain.  I did stop the use of the drug for a time, because of some of the reports; but found I feel better on it.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries

column9: I am responding well to this medication, however, I have run out and have been without for a week now.  What are the withdrawl symptoms?

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: rmathys, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a hsysterectomy 5 weeks ago. so far, i guess its o.k. i get hot flashes some. headaches. after read side effects, kind of wondereing if i should change.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Cons:  leg aches & foot cramps, weight gain. No sex drive at all.  Pros:  I can sleep again.  Moods are better. My dosage is 0.3 as I am in the step down process.  I also am taking 10mg of Lexapro.  So not 100% positive which drug is giving me the side effects, good & bad.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy in July '08.  I have been taking Premarin since my release from the hospital.  I have been very satisified, however after reading some of the comments, I wonder if I need to change.  I am taking .625 and I am still having night sweats about 3-4 nights per week and sometimes during the day.  Although this may be just the summer in the deep south.  However, my mood swings are GONE, which I had prior to having my hysterectomy.  My sexual drive has decreased compared to what it was before my hysterectomy and Premarin.  Any Suggestion from anyone would be greatly appreciated.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: keb200278, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had to have a complete hystorectomy at the age of 30. I have been on premarin for a little over a year. I started out having headaches about once a week to having one nearly every day!!! They are getting worse!! I also have very little sex drive, which never was a problem before the surgery. I'm not sure if its the drug but I'm going back to find out this next week.

column2: Jamie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was taking this med due to a complete hysterectomy. I used it to control my symptoms. However, I had severe joint pain (which is listed as a side effect). I didn't realize this until after I was misdiagnosed with FIBROMYALGIA. Because of the fibromyalgia symptoms I took an anti-depressant which helps with the symptoms. That pill caused me to have confusion, memory loss, & I can't barely do my job. This pill was paxil.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: lisab, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking premarin for almost 9 yr's now and the past couple of years I've had terrible,debilitating cramps in my feet when sleeping.  I want to fing out if I stop premarin what the side affects are such as weight gain?

column2: BABYGIRL22, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I AM A 28YR OLD THAT HAD A FULL HYSTERECTOMY ON APRIL 29TH AND EVER SINCE I WAS RELEASED FROM THE HOSPITAL I HAVE HAD A WHITE THICK DISCHARGE THAT SMELLS LIKE STRONG URINE AND MY DR IS TRYING TO TELL ME ITS FROM MY PREMARIN. IF ANYONE IS HAVING OR HAD THE SAME THING PLEASE ANSWER BACK BECAUSE I HAVE NEVER HAD THIS ISSUE AND ITS REALLY BOTHERING ME.

column2: camille098, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I took it for 20 yrs.not having a Dr.tell me the risks of stroke,heart problems & gallbladder disease.All three of these things happened to me the most recent was a Stroke on Mar.21,09 at the age of 52.After the stroke I immediately went off Premarin myself.I mentioned it to my gyn & fam.Dr.they both told me to take it for the rest of my life.I saw a cardiologist he asked if anyone had told me to stop taking it due to stroke?I said no but I took myself off of it.Great stay off of it.Always insist your physician explain the risks.I had a hysterectomy at 32 due to cervical cancer.If you must take it do this use it on the worst hot/cold flash days for a week then stop it until the following month.I did this for a short time because I was so miserable but have since learnt to deal with the symptoms.Remember demand answers from your physician/pharmacist weigh the risks and decide it's your health not theirs.I wouldn't want anyone to experience a Stroke like I had.The hot flashes won't cause a stroke & other illness like the premarin.Good luck and God's Blessings to everyone taking it.Use it with extreme caution.It's your health.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At 37 I had my "female parts" removed.  This was a year ago.  Premarin is my second experiment with estrogen replacement.  I cannot stand these drugs.  I have constant nausea, migraines and mood swings.  Honestly, I went six months without taking anything and in my opinion was much healthier.  Are the benefits these drugs really worth it?

column2: nannyj0116@yahoo.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This has not worked for me / I had a complete Hyst.Should I be having these emotional turmoil just 3 weeks after Hyst.?What is max dose of Premarin?

column2: auddiecat, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Anyone considering the use of this drug MUST discuss the side effects and your current health conditions.  I took this for over two years before stopping...I was never told that I should NOT be taking this drug due to severe vericose veins in my legs and breast cancer in my family!ALWAYS talk to your doctor!!

column2: BARBIE, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: At 26 I had to have a partial hysterectomy due to a number of reasons, leaving me with only one ovary.  Less than a year later, I had to have my ovary removed because I had developed a tumor in my ovary.  Before my surgery, my ovary stopped functioning.  I had hot flashes, night sweats, and fatigue.  I have only been on premarin for 2 weeks, but I immediately felt the results.  No hot flashes, no night sweats, and no fatigue.  As a mother of 4, with a full time job, this medication was a God send.  I have had a few side effects, such as leg pain and headaches, but over the counter pain meds and a heating pad help.  I am willing to deal with sore legs and headaches if it means I have the energy to care for my children.  I am not concerned with weight gain as this medications seems to have deminished my appetite, and I hit the ground running at 5:00 am everyday.  As far as the more serious health concerns, I am fairly young and no longer have any female organs, so they seem to be non-issues at this time.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 50 yrs old and had a complete hysterectomy due to fibriods. Couldnt sleep, have hot flashes, night sweats and mood swings. Have gained weight since operation (5 mths ago). Dr put me on Premarin but worried about more weight gain. Does it finally stop?

column2: bchbum, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had severe loss of sleep due to frequent night sweats. Daytime hot flashes as well as exhaustion due to interrupted sleep pattern. Premarin worked like a miracle on these, but my periods resumed monthly, sore breasts,and some weight gain. I will continue taking it because I can't function without sleep.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: Jeana, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy at age 30, due to fibroid tumors, ovarian cycsts and adhesions. I have always had problems with my period, either being irregular or very painful and a lot of clots, since as far back as I can remember. My OB started me on Premarin while I was still in the hospital, however I got very ill after returning home and had to go without the pills for a week. It was a very miserable week, I had horrible hot flashes, night sweats, headaches, etc. I could not imagine having to be going through this with out the Premarin. My OB said for someone my age the advantages of taking a estrogen only pill far out way the risks. Since I have no female reproductive organs left I do not have to worry about the increase risk of cancer and for my age that is really the only risk. She said I will probably have to take it until I am around 50 years old then I can reasses. I started out taking .625mg per day, in June of 08 I recentaly went up to 1.25 mg per day due to increasing hot flashes, headaches and discharge. I have gained quite a bit of weight but I dont know if it was from this or the Lyrica that I was put on at the same time.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
vdemoss, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had night hot flashes that would wake me up at 2 a.m., then I would not be able to go back to sleep.  The hot flashes would come in the mornings 3 or 4 times in a row.  My doctor recommended HRT and in a weeks time I have been sleeping all through the night and haven't had a hot flash in 4 days! Its a miracle!

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: PodAngel, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy in July, 2008 and started using Premarin immediately. It has helped fairly well with night sweats and moodiness but I have put on at least 20 lbs.

column2: sisterkbj1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on premarin for 7 years following a complete hysterctomy with no subsequent problems as I know of. I have had numerous bouts with cysts (benign) and recently had a gall bladder attack with my gall bladder being removed w/gall stones included, I now have spasms in my upper stomach, some blurred vision and increased loss of vision, minute loss of hearing, but none of which are caused by this medication at least it was never mentioned at the time of any of my diagnoses. I am 53 years old and my doctor loves to prescribe medication. He feels the quality of life is more significant than the quanity and with a sufficient amount of drugs you can be pain-free for the less time you have to live. I disagree and sometimes do not take my medicines as instructed because I seem to have a new pain every week and I am already taking 4 different medications daily. All of this said, by the information printed above, some of my problems could have stemmed from this medication.

column2: cathy, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this for probably 25 years after a hysterectomy that left my ovaries.  My Dr thought it could help my deppression and it did.  I haven't dared go off it but my Dr now is recommending that I do. I am so much older now that I am afraid of how my body will respond to not having it.

column2: daylilydiva, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy at 35 and had been on Premarin for 30 years with no side effects until about 3 years ago when Kaiser - in it's wisdom - refused to supply it and changed me to Estradiol.  Gradually my hair thinned - which I could live with if necessary - but when I developed a goatee my husband envied (and which involved shaving twice a day) and extremely sore, hard breasts (especially the nipples which couldn't be touched without pain), I convinced my doctor to put me on Premarin again.  Within 3 days my breast symptoms disappeared although the beard is still there (but seems to be getting less).  The Estradiol was costing me $33 for 3 month's supply; the Premarin is $135 but I don't care if it takes care of my symptoms.

column2: Still Hanging in, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Had to have a total hysterectomy when I was 23 years old. I am now 49 and using Premaring faithfully. If I happen to misses doses for 3-4 I suffer from severe (suicidal) depression. I love this stuff!

column2: SusanJ, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Decades ago I began having hot flashes and night sweats. I was first given Estrace and got a mustaches. At some point I started on Premarin and Prempro. A pharmacist told me Provera made his wife "mean. The Provera just didn't "feel right" to me. I am OCD about how I feel. Always searching for symptoms when I take a vitamin or a prescription. Then I started reading negatives about Provera and stopped it and have been on just Premarin for decades. Provera is "poison" said one prominent physician and author of many popular books. I don't want to poison myself so I just take Premarin. Sure, I may be rolling the dice; but I feel well rested and relaxed while doing so. Never stop taking Premarin suddenly. You have to wean off it. I tried in 1988 stopping it and I felt like committing murder. So I re-started it and will continue as long as I can get my wrinkled old hands on it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This medication was a godsend for me.  I was having so many hot flashes & nightsweats,severe anxity&depression, I felt like my life was not worth living! The premarin took away ALL symptoms, Im great.  I was VERY concerned w/ sideeffects ect but had NO trouble at all! Thank God!!!

column2: momoffour, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Had a hysterectomy at age 36 after a hemmorage from a c-section.  Started have night sweats, hot flashes and severe mood swings.  Started taking .625mg and immediately all symptoms disappeared.  Dr. said that the hysterectomy should not have caused premature menopause, but had no trouble before. I have been able to loose weight also.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: evdeb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Premarin for about a year.  After my hysterectomy, I had awful hot flashes all day and night.  As a result, I was awakened about 12 to 14 times a night and was unable to sleep.  I was completely exhausted.  This drug has allowed my life to get back to normal.  It has eliminated all hot flashes and I sleep all night again.  I am currently taking .625 and, because of all the controversy with HRT, on my next doctor visit, I think I will try the lower dose.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It worked like a magic pill.The symptoms stopped almost immediately.It was like giving a drink of water to a dry plant, and i felt like the dry plant.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy at 37 but left the ovaries and they quit working 3 years later. Premarin stopped the hot flashes, weakness, sweating, shaking, & exhaustion within 2 days.  Have taken it for 20 years with no problems.  Because of health scares, tried to lower dose to .625 but got severe symptoms again & returned to .9  Health scare bugs my doctor, she says she gets conflicting reports constantly & just lets me choose whether I want to stay on it. I look really young still, dont know if the years of estrogen have anything to do with it.

Does anyone have any suggestions on how to stop night sweats in a different, less risky manner?  Thanks!

column9: It reduced hormonal migraines, hot flashes, insomnia.  On the downside, it increased my appetite and gives me a feeling of ovulating all month long.  I have returned to monthly periods on this drug, while without it I had periods about every 3 months.
